AI Description: NAMD, or Nanoscale Molecular Dynamics, is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance simulation of large biomolecular systems. It is developed by the Theoretical and Computational Biophysics Group at the University of Illinois and funded by the NIH.
Core Features: Molecular Dynamics Simulations At The Atomistic Level, Parallel Computing Support For Efficient Simulations, Scalability For Large Biomolecular Systems, Integration With Cuda For Gpu Acceleration
General Tags: Molecular Dynamics, Biomolecular Systems, Simulation, Parallel Computing, Cuda Acceleration
